content.description:
Illud te, nulla fati quod lege tenetur, 
pro Latio obtestorobtestor, -ari = oro, -are, pro maiestatemaiestas, -atis, f.: dignity tuorum: 
cum iam conubiis pacem felicibus (esto) 
component, cum iam leges et foederafoedus, -eris, n.: alliance iungentiungo, -ere: to join, 

ne vetus indigenasindigenus, -a, -um, adj.: native nomen mutare LatinosLatinus, -a, -um, adj.: Latin, of Latium 
neuneu, conj.: nor TroasTroas = acc. pl., “Trojans” fieri iubeas Teucrosque vocari 
aut vocem mutare viros aut vertere vestem. 
Sit Latium, sint AlbaniAlbanus, -a, -um, adj.: Alban, inhabiting Alba Longa (a city in Italy) per saecula reges, 
sit Romana potens ItalaItalus, -a, -um, adj.: Italian virtute propagopropago, -inis, f.: offspring: 

occidit, occideritque sinassino, -ere: to allow cum nomine Troia.

Aeneid 12.819-828
content.question:
Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words.

Identify what Paris did to make Juno angry and thus cause the Trojan War.

frqParts.text:

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
